posts.post_content: I didn't realize that rats are so tribal. You could make a rat deck with cards like [Ratcatcher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ratcatcher), [Swarm of Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swarm of Rats), and [Patron of the Nezumi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Patron of the Nezumi). (Along with this card, of course.)

posts.post_content: This card is pretty ridiculous. Definitely one of the few gems of the Kamigawa block (by gems I mean broken as hell). The best part about this dude is the fact that you don't even need to sacrifice a non-token rat, so you can keep sacrificing the tokens over and over.

Posted By: atogatogatogatog (12/8/2011 8:47:40 AM)

posts.post_content:
I've lost count of the number of times I've taken this card and [Thousand-Year Elixir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thousand-Year Elixir) and turned it into something horrible (for my opponent!) 10,000 rat tokens is enough to put a crimp in anyone's day. A friend of mine does the same, but always tries to have [Door of Destinies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Door of Destinies) out first - when there's suddenly there's 500 rats, all of which are 501/501, baring down at you, things get messy.  
  
Well priced, good ability, definitely deserving of both the Rare and Legendary status'.
